availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas P. Campbell (Hopkins County, KY, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Jane Campbell. Father of Catherine G. Campbell, Samuel G. Campbell, Isabelle Campbell, Mary G. Campbell, Martha Campbell, Malvina Campbell, and John P. Campbell. Farmer in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 2, p. 452B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 2, p. 642.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 805-06.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 218B.
"Thomas Poage Campbell (Birth year-Death year)," Find A Grave, Memorial #68432443, accessed January 12, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68432443.
